news.title: AI learns to tell jokes to squirrels
news.body: Researchers at the fictional University of Fableland developed an AI that communicates with squirrels and tells them jokes about acorns. It's a groundbreaking step in interspecies comedy.

news.title: Startup launches AI assistant for dragons
news.body: Imaginary startup DragonAI unveiled a digital assistant for dragons that helps manage hoards, schedule fire-breathing sessions, and plan flights. Investors are excited about the mythical market opportunity.

news.title: Virtual reality game lets AI run for president
news.body: In the new VR game 'Election Simulator 3000', players control an AI candidate running for president in a fictional election. The AI debates, makes policy decisions and tries to win over human and robot voters.

news.title: AI painter creates art using cat whiskers
news.body: A creative AI has started painting impressionist landscapes using the tactile feedback of cat whiskers. The resulting works are said to capture the essence of feline curiosity.

jokes: Why did the AI take a break? It needed more 'training' data.
How does an AI throw a party? It uses a neural network to plan everything.
What do you call an AI's musical? 'Les Mis√©rables' because of all the misclassification loss.

shorts.title: AI Fictional News Roundup
shorts.description: A humorous recap of AI squirrels telling jokes, dragon assistants, presidential AI candidates and whisker-based art. It's all made up for laughs!

shorts.title: Imaginary Innovations
shorts.description: Exploring the whimsical side of AI with creative inventions like mythical assistants and paintings inspired by cats.

videos.title: AI trust paradox explained
videos.description: An animated explainer on why the 'trust paradox' persists with AI adoption.
